titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection WAG.310

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-07T15:57-0400

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: CWA Local 1060 represents workers at Lucent (formerly Bell Labs, in Murray Hill, NJ). This collection consists of material compiled by Raymond A. Singley (1920-2005), who served as a local steward and executive board member. The collection includes minutes, reports, stewards manuals, bargaining and grievance materials, and CWA memorabilia.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Dawn Zetto sent a gift of Raymond Singley's files on the Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.006.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2088. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection; WAG 310; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

controlaccess.corpname: Communications Workers of America. Local 1060 (North Plainfield, N.J.).
